title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example are enabled but do not have any effect when moved. This is misleading, especially when opening a small image like an icon. Scrollbars should be disabled in this example.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved, but they do not have any effect.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to prevent confusion. They should not be able to be moved or have any effect when opening a small image.
SR:
1. Open Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
2. Launch the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled.
4. Try moving the scrollbars and notice that they do not have any effect.
5. Open a small image, like an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are present but do not do anything.
